meanings.definition: A highly contagious viral disease characterized by fever and a rash of small red spots.
meanings.sent1: Smallpox can spread quickly from person to person.
meanings.sent2: The outbreak of smallpox led to widespread panic in the community.
meanings.sent3: The smallpox virus decided to throw a party on my skin, but I wasn't invited.
meanings.sent4: The smallpox outbreak was like a wildfire, spreading rapidly through the population.
meanings.sent5: The image of smallpox spots covering the body is a haunting reminder of the disease's severity.

meanings.definition: A disease caused by the variola virus, marked by fever and a distinctive rash.
meanings.sent1: Doctors worked tirelessly to contain the smallpox outbreak.
meanings.sent2: The smallpox vaccine helped eradicate the disease worldwide.
meanings.sent3: Smallpox and chickenpox decided to have a race to see who could cover more skin with spots.
meanings.sent4: The smallpox epidemic swept through the town like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The scars left by smallpox serve as a reminder of the battles fought against the virus.
